title: Solid Mechanics Lab seminar series
text:
LMS seminar series schedule
The LMS seminars usually take place every week.

Date and Time: Thursday, 2:00 p.m. – 3:00 p.m.
Venue: Amphi 104 (Pôle Mécanique)


Schedule for the autumn semester 2025




Google calendar


You can subscribe to the calendar using this link.

title: Solid Mechanics Lab seminar series
text:
Register as a speaker
Please indicate in the sheet below your:

Name
Lab
Presentation title
Format

Short (around 20 minutes)
Long (around 40-45 minutes)

Any other remarks (schedule constraints, other format, etc.)

The sheet can also be directly accessed from: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1U3RrbkfuEJfEymMEQy5uzr9ZSJeeTyjdcvFXVCh01B8/edit?gid=2037295576#gid=2037295576.

title: Solid Mechanics Lab seminar series
text:
This wiki serves as a central hub for the seminar series of the Laboratoire de Mècanique des Solides/Solid Mechanics Laboratory (LMS). This series consists of weekly seminars by esteemed researchers from across the world in the broad area of mechanics of solids, structures and materials.
Organizer: Vignesh Kannan (vignesh.kannan@polytechnique.edu)
Here, you will find:

Schedule: View the upcoming seminar schedule.
Past Seminars Archive: Access previous seminar presentations and slide decks.
Invitations: (For internal memebers only) If you wish to invite a guest, please enter their information here.
Miscellaneous: Additional information and tools to support your daily scientific activities.







There will be no regular LMS seminar next week. Instead, we will have a special 3-day conference in tribute to Prof. Laurent Jacquin.
Link: https://conf-ljacquin.sciencesconf.org/

 Announcement

title: Additional resources
text:
The package microtype helps improving the rendering of long text easily
Quarto is an open-source librairy that enables to create dynamic scientific documents, presentations, and websites using Markdown, LaTeX, and a variety of programming languages (including python, R, etc.).

The html presentations can then be translated into pdfs using decktape.

install node brew install node
install decktape npm install -g decktape
reveal --size=1600x1000 presentation.html presentation.pdf

title: Additional resources
text:

title: Additional resources
text:
Figures editing

Miscellaneous

Scientific drawing with inkscape monthly letter here.
Good practices regarding figure formating

Colour science (Crameri, Shephard, and Heron 2020) and colour map choices
10 rules for better figures in scientific writting (Rougier, Droettboom, and Bourne 2014)
Nice tool for plotting data in latex: PGFplot

title: Solid Mechanics Lab seminar series
text:
Solicitations for speakers
(For members of the mechanics labs of IP Paris only)
If you would like to invite a speaker, please fill the sheet at this link: https://sdrive.cnrs.fr/s/FPx6nDNHM9dkJz5.
Access password for the file has been sent to all internal members of the mechanics labs of IP Paris. If you fall into this category and have not received the password, please send an email to vignesh.kannan@polytechnique.edu.
Or simply send me the following details.

Seminar series (Would you like the guest to give the LMS/Meca seminar?)
Name of the guest speaker
Laboratory and institution/university
Your name, lab (as the host)
Scheduling constraints
